title: Policy and Planning for Green Infrastructure Implementation

questions.question: What is a key objective of green infrastructure policy?
choices: To increase urban sprawl
To integrate nature-based solutions into urban development
To promote more concrete infrastructure
To reduce green spaces in cities
questions.answer: To integrate nature-based solutions into urban development

questions.question: Which of the following is a common regulatory approach for promoting green infrastructure?
choices: Stormwater management regulations
Increasing impervious surface requirements
Mandating the use of non-native plant species
Prohibiting rainwater harvesting
questions.answer: Stormwater management regulations

questions.question: What does Philadelphia's Green City, Clean Waters program mandate?
choices: All new developments must have swimming pools
The first inch of stormwater runoff must be managed through green infrastructure
All buildings must be painted green
No trees can be planted in new developments
questions.answer: The first inch of stormwater runoff must be managed through green infrastructure

questions.question: How can zoning ordinances promote green infrastructure?
choices: By prohibiting all forms of landscaping
By requiring a certain percentage of green space or permeable surfaces
By mandating the use of only concrete in new developments
By banning the use of rain gardens
questions.answer: By requiring a certain percentage of green space or permeable surfaces

questions.question: What is the purpose of Seattle's Green Factor program?
choices: To reduce the amount of green space in the city
To require new developments to achieve a minimum score based on landscaping elements
To promote the use of artificial turf in all new developments
To ban the planting of trees in urban areas
questions.answer: To require new developments to achieve a minimum score based on landscaping elements

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an incentive program for green infrastructure?
choices: Increasing property taxes for properties with green roofs
Fining homeowners who install rain barrels
Offering tax credits for installing permeable pavement
Prohibiting the use of native plants in landscaping
questions.answer: Offering tax credits for installing permeable pavement

questions.question: What is the maximum amount offered by Washington D.C.'s RiverSmart Homes program for green infrastructure installations?
Why is it important to integrate green infrastructure into broader urban planning efforts?
choices: To create a cohesive, city-wide approach
To reduce the effectiveness of green infrastructure
To increase urban heat island effects
To promote the use of more concrete in cities
questions.answer: To create a cohesive, city-wide approach

questions.question: Which city's comprehensive plan includes specific policies and objectives related to green infrastructure implementation?
choices: New York City
Los Angeles
Chicago
Portland, Oregon
questions.answer: Portland, Oregon

questions.question: What is a common challenge for green infrastructure projects?
choices: Too much funding available
Lack of concrete materials
Funding
Excessive public support
questions.answer: Funding

questions.question: How can stormwater fees based on impervious surface area help promote green infrastructure?
choices: By discouraging the use of permeable surfaces
By generating revenue for green infrastructure projects and incentivizing runoff reduction
By promoting the use of more concrete
By increasing urban heat island effects
questions.answer: By generating revenue for green infrastructure projects and incentivizing runoff reduction

questions.question: What is the purpose of Washington D.C.'s stormwater retention credit trading program?
choices: To discourage green infrastructure projects
To increase stormwater runoff
To allow developers to meet stormwater management requirements by paying for green infrastructure elsewhere
To promote the use of impervious surfaces
questions.answer: To allow developers to meet stormwater management requirements by paying for green infrastructure elsewhere

questions.question: Why is it important to consider local context when developing green infrastructure policies?
choices: To ensure policies are inappropriate for the area
To make policies more complex and difficult to implement
To ignore community priorities
To adapt approaches to local climate, infrastructure, and governance structures
questions.answer: To adapt approaches to local climate, infrastructure, and governance structures

questions.question: What type of green infrastructure solutions might be most appropriate for Timor-Leste?
choices: High-tech, expensive solutions
Low-cost, low-tech solutions that are easily maintained
Solutions that ignore local water scarcity issues
Projects that only benefit a small portion of the population
questions.answer: Low-cost, low-tech solutions that are easily maintained

questions.question: Why is community engagement important in green infrastructure planning?
choices: To exclude residents from the planning process
To ensure projects don't meet community needs
To build public support and promote long-term stewardship
To make the planning process longer and more difficult
questions.answer: To build public support and promote long-term stewardship

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of emphasizing multi-benefit green infrastructure projects in Timor-Leste?
choices: It could address pressing local issues like flood mitigation and water scarcity
It would increase urban heat island effects
It would reduce community support for green infrastructure
It would make projects more expensive and difficult to implement
questions.answer: It could address pressing local issues like flood mitigation and water scarcity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a benefit of green infrastructure?
choices: Improved air quality
Reduced urban heat island effect
Better stormwater management
Increased impervious surface area
questions.answer: Increased impervious surface area

questions.question: What type of planning document would be most appropriate for incorporating long-term green infrastructure goals?
choices: Daily maintenance schedules
Short-term budget plans
Comprehensive plans or sustainability plans
Traffic management plans
questions.answer: Comprehensive plans or sustainability plans

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a green infrastructure technique?
choices: Concrete channelization of streams
Installation of impermeable pavement
Creation of rain gardens
Removal of all street trees
questions.answer: Creation of rain gardens

questions.question: What role can public-private partnerships play in green infrastructure implementation?
choices: They can hinder project development
They can help finance and implement projects at scale
They always increase project costs
They reduce community involvement in projects
questions.answer: They can help finance and implement projects at scale

questions.question: Why might emphasizing the multiple benefits of green infrastructure be particularly important in Timor-Leste?
choices: To make projects more expensive
To reduce community support
To address multiple pressing issues with limited resources
To complicate project planning
questions.answer: To address multiple pressing issues with limited resources

questions.question: What is a potential challenge of implementing green infrastructure in Timor-Leste?
choices: Too much funding available
Overabundance of technical expertise
Limited resources for maintenance
Lack of pressing environmental issues
questions.answer: Limited resources for maintenance

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a component of a comprehensive green infrastructure policy approach?
choices: Regulatory measures
Incentive programs
Integrated planning
Mandating increased use of impervious surfaces
questions.answer: Mandating increased use of impervious surfaces

questions.question: What is the primary goal of incorporating green infrastructure into urban planning?
choices: To increase urban sprawl
To create more sustainable and resilient cities
To reduce green spaces in urban areas
To promote the use of non-native plant species
questions.answer: To create more sustainable and resilient cities

questions.question: How can green infrastructure help address climate change in urban areas?
choices: By increasing greenhouse gas emissions
By promoting the use of fossil fuels
By reducing urban heat island effects and managing increased stormwater
By encouraging more car use in cities
questions.answer: By reducing urban heat island effects and managing increased stormwater

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of using native plant species in green infrastructure projects?
choices: They require more water and maintenance
They are less adapted to local climate conditions
They support local ecosystems and biodiversity
They are always more expensive than non-native species
questions.answer: They support local ecosystems and biodiversity

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a green infrastructure feature that can be incorporated into street design?
choices: Widening roads to accommodate more cars
Removing all vegetation from streetscapes
Installing bioswales along roadsides
Increasing the amount of impervious surface
questions.answer: Installing bioswales along roadsides

questions.question: What role can education play in green infrastructure implementation?
choices: It can reduce public awareness of green infrastructure benefits
It can help build community support and promote stewardship
It can make projects more difficult to implement
It has no impact on green infrastructure success
questions.answer: It can help build community support and promote stewardship

questions.question: How can green infrastructure policies address social equity issues?
choices: By concentrating all projects in wealthy neighborhoods
By ignoring low-income communities in planning processes
By ensuring equitable distribution of green infrastructure benefits across different communities
By increasing environmental burdens on disadvantaged neighborhoods
questions.answer: By ensuring equitable distribution of green infrastructure benefits across different communities
